text: we've already heard today from the
British government which accused the
Russian military intelligence unit known
as giu
of being behind several cyberattacks
more accusations were made just a few
hours ago in the Netherlands which said
it had worked with British and Swiss
intelligence services to uncover a group
of Russian cyber spies
there'd allegedly been trying to hack
into the UN's chemical weapons watchdog
and also the world anti-doping agency
and even the Malaysian investigation
into the shooting down of flight mh17
over Ukraine all of those could be seen
as areas where Russia stood accused of
illegal behavior here's how the UK
ambassador to the Netherlands Peter
Wilson put it as our attributions today
have made clear the giu has interfered
in free elections and pursued a hostile
campaign of cyber attacks against state
and civilian targets the GRU is an
aggressive well-funded official body of
the Russian state it can no longer be
allowed to act aggressively across the
world against vital international
organizations with apparent impunity
well that news conference in The Hague
came after the UK government had taken
the unusual step of directly and openly
accusing the Russian GRU military
intelligence of being behind not only
several cyber attacks but also the nerve
agent poisoning in the English town of
Salisbury which left a former Russian
spy circus crippled and his daughter
Yulia fighting for their lives and
another woman dead here's the UK defense
secretary Gavin Williamson what we have
seen is the attribution of Russian
military intelligence and their
indiscriminate and reckless attacks
against our institutions and
organizations there's actually have no
military value and what we're seeing is
that Russia is quite willing to use such
weapons such as cyberattacks against
these organizations and here at NATO we
stand shoulder to shoulder with our
allies in unity
against such actions we are not going to
be backward leaning we're going to
actually make it clear where Russia acts
that we are going to be exposing that
action and we believe that by doing so
this will act as a disincentive for
acting in such a way in the future
well Moscow has consistently denied any
involvement in the scruple poisoning and
has been quick to respond to these
latest allegations the Russian Foreign
Ministry spokeswoman Maria Zakharova
said the claims were mind-boggling she
accused the British officials of being
fanatically convinced that their right
she said the UK was refusing to work
with Russia and instead just resorting
to its own information attacks
